msItem.title: Prayers and meditations for private use
Hours of the Passion
msItem.rubric: Hier beginnient die getijde van den lijden ons lieven heren Ihesus Christus
msItem.incipit: Gedenck des bermentlicken affscheidens dat ons lieve Here (vespers)
O lieve gemijnder sueter Here (prayer for vespers)

msItem.title: Prayers
msItem.note: A series of seven prayers, here attributed to Pope Innocent V, carrying an indulgence
msItem.rubric: Die paus Innocentius quintus dichte dese oracien op die seven getijden der heiliger kercken
msItem.incipit: Du schoen god und licht alle onser duijsternisse Suete here Ihesus christus weest ons een geleide in deser ellendiger werlt

msItem.title: Short hours of Our Lady's Passion
msItem.rubric: Dijt sijnt die getijden op onser liever vrouwen druk die sante Clemens die paus gemacket hevet…
msItem.incipit: Toe metten tijt wart Maria gebaetschopt
msItem.note: Another MS. is Brussels, Bibl. Royale 21953, fol.365, see M. Meertens, De Godsvrucht in de Nederlanden VI, 1934, p. 139. Fol. 17v–18v are blank.

msItem.title: Prayers
msItem.note: Twenty-two prayers on the life of Christ.
msItem.rubric: Hier begijnnen suverlicke gebeder enn oeffinge von den leven enn liden ons lieven heren Ihesus Christus

msItem.note: The first begins:
msItem.incipit: O ewige almechtich Got ic aenbede dijn gotlicke moegentheit

msItem.note: The last (fol. 39) begins:
msItem.incipit: O barmhertige Godes soen o suete here Ihesus

msItem.finalRubric: Hier ennden die gebeder von der kijntheit Ihesus enn van synre wandelinge mytten mynschen in der erden

msItem.title: Prayers
msItem.note: Twenty-six prayers on the Passion
msItem.rubric: Hiernae volgen die gebeder van der passien Christus
msItem.note: The first begins:
msItem.incipit: Ick gebenedie enn danck du here I.C. barmhertige verloesser der geloinger

msItem.title: Meditation consisting of twenty-eight prayers
msItem.rubric: Hier begijnt eijn devoete medetacie des berch van Calu(a)rien…

msItem.note: First prayer:
msItem.incipit: O guedertieren here I.C. alre sacht moedichste lemken

msItem.note: Second prayer:
msItem.incipit: O myn behalder

msItem.note: Third prayer:
msItem.incipit: West gegruet berch van Caluarien

msItem.note: Fourth prayer:
msItem.incipit: O guede Ihesus gij wart in den cruce verhaven

msItem.note: Most of the remaining prayers begin with formulae similar to the third and fourth

msItem.title: Prayer
msItem.incipit: Ick doepe my alle dage seven werff

msItem.rubric: Dit naegeschreven gebedeken wart sante Augustijnus geapenbaert…
msItem.incipit: O alre lieffste here I.C. om die alre suetste wonde

msItem.rubric: Dyt gebet plach die heilige vader sante Bernardus
msItem.incipit: O guede Ihesus, O mijlde Ihesus
msItem.note: The Latin text is pr. Leroquais, Livres d'heures II.345

msItem.title: Prayer
msItem.rubric: Hier begijnt cen suverlick gebet van den sueten gebenediden naem Ihesus
msItem.incipit: O du barmhertige Ihesus

msItem.title: Prayers relating to the childhood of Christ

msItem.rubric: Eyn gebet tot onsenheren Ihesus
msItem.incipit: O Ihesus du alre myldeste enn begerlicste kyndekyn

msItem.rubric: gebet
msItem.incipit: O mynnenclicke Ihesus O begerlicke Ihesus

msItem.rubric: gebet
msItem.incipit: Gegruet sustu mijn alre liefste brudegom alre sueste Ihesus

msItem.rubric: Eyn gebet tot Ihesus
msItem.incipit: Gegruet moestu sijn O Ihesus alre suuerlichste Alre genoechlichste

msItem.rubric: Dyt es gebet vanden geboerten ihesus
msItem.incipit: O gemynde Ihesus dijn gebuerte moet my neder bugen tot ortmodicheit

msItem.rubric: vanden geboerten Ihesus gebet
msItem.incipit: O alre sueste guedertierenste enn (?) mynlicste kynt Ihesus woe groet is die volheit dynre mylder sueter barmherticheit in dijnre dancbariger toe comst

msItem.rubric: Hier begijnt eyn schoen gebet van den liden ons lieven heren
msItem.incipit: Nu begeet ic aen te sien Christus liden enn myn leven
O alre lieffste mylde barmhertige genedige suete gemynde here I.C.

msItem.rubric: Eyn gebet van onsen lieven heren
msItem.incipit: O myn gemynde rotvercoeren rotdusenden ic offer dujr die onspreckelicke sueticheit die van ewicheit rot dynen gotlicken herten gebloeten heest in den vader

msItem.title: Prayers to the Trinity
msItem.rubric: Hier begijnt eijn schoen oeffinge enn dancberheit Doer die wecke toe der heiliger drieuoldicheit enn is seer guet gelesen die mannendach
msItem.note: One for each day of the week, the first (for Monday) beg.:
msItem.incipit: O almechtich ewige got, O heilige drievoldicheit

msItem.title: Meditation on the Pater Noster and Ave Maria
msItem.incipit: Onse lieve here sprack
Vader ons… Ick offer dij lieve here hemelsche vader.
msItem.note: Also in Brussels Bibl. Royale MS.11231–6, fol.184v, see Neertens op.cit. VI.65

msItem.title: Prayer
msItem.rubric: Soe wije dit gebet leest mit ennen pater noster voer onser lieuer vrouwen beelt ter noet die verdient xxx dusent iaer aflaets pater noster
msItem.incipit: Ic offer dij fonteijne der genaden (?) Dit pater noster enn aue maria

msItem.title: Prayer
msItem.rubric: Soe wie dit gebet leest mit eijnen pater noster voer dat gecroende hoest ons lieuen heren die verdient drie dusent iaer aflaits
msItem.incipit: O lieve here ic gruet dijn heilige hoeft gecroent mit dornen

msItem.rubric: Als gij in die kerc komt so seget aldus’
msItem.incipit: O lieve here ic valle u te voeten

msItem.rubric: Hier begijnt een alte suverlicke gebet van onser liever vrouwen
msItem.incipit: O alre genedichste here I.C. ic danck dich verloesser der werlt.

msItem.note: There follow seven prayers to Our Lady, each followed by Ave Maria, the first beg.:
msItem.incipit: O Maria du bis eijn sal

msItem.note: Followed by three further prayers, the first:
msItem.incipit: O wee eyn geboeren soen troester

msItem.rubric: Hier begijnt eyn ynnich gebet totter moder Godes voer die ontfenckenisse des heiligen sacrements
msItem.incipit: Ick biddij gebenedide vrouwe Maria hemelsche keiserijnne

msItem.rubric: Heir begijnen vijff ave marien voer die ontfenis
msItem.incipit: O lieve Maria ic vermane u der ontfenckenisse
msItem.note: Taken from St. Mechtild's Liber specialis gratiae I.43.

msItem.title: Prayer to Our Lady
msItem.incipit: O Marie eijn rosen bloym der kuysheit

msItem.title: Devotional work prescribing prayers and meditations for use by religious throughout the day
msItem.incipit: Des morgens toe vier uren soe richt u wackerlic
msItem.explicit: soe gedijncket der geboerte des alren soetste soen gotz

msItem.title: Devotion of seven Pater Nosters and Ave Marias
msItem.note: According to the rubric given by an angel to a pilgrim on the road to Rome during the ‘annus aureus’
msItem.incipit: Dat erste Pater Noster enn Ave Maria soldij sprecken in der eeren

msItem.title: Prayers on the Passion
msItem.incipit: O mijn alre liefste here I.C. alset sich nakende was dijnre bitterre passien

msItem.title: Dialogue between Christ and a good man
msItem.incipit: Eijn guet mensche eerden ons Heren geboert enn sijn leven

msItem.title: Instructions on preparation for confession
msItem.incipit: Item als die mensche sijn bicht doet soe heeft hij mijt gode gerekent enn sijn scholt bekeen

msItem.title: Instructions on penitence
msItem.rubric: Van den berou
msItem.incipit: Retouwe ey schet groeten druck enn suchtynge des herten om dat hy vertoernet heest synen schepper

msItem.title: Instructions on how to go to confession
msItem.rubric: Van der bichten
msItem.incipit: Nu verstant wael hoe een mensche bichten sal op dat die bicht doge tot salicheit sijnre sielen

msItem.rubric: Van voldoen
msItem.incipit: Nader bicht coemt voldoen Dat is die beteringe die een doen sal nae den wille

msItem.title: Homily
msItem.rubric: Een suverlicke leeringe van den religiosen hoe hy leven sal
msItem.incipit: Sante Pauwels seyt recht als die doede heeft verloeren
msItem.explicit: nyet daer tegen werdigen en mach

msItem.title: Devotion
msItem.incipit: Bystu een getrouwe bruit soe en laet die wapen

msItem.rubric: Hier begijnnen drie punten die sant Bernardus synen broederen liet aen synen lesten eynde toe eenen testament
msItem.incipit: Dat eerste is dat ich nyemant schandelisieren

msItem.rubric: noch vyf punten liet hy synen broederen
msItem.incipit: Dat eerste was dat hy sich nye geergert en had aen geynnen dyngen
Item onse lieue here deit vyf deynck den die myt synen bedroeffenysse tot om comet Dat eerst is dat hy om alle syn sonden vergeuet

msItem.title: Prayers
msItem.incipit: Sante pauwels spreckt alsoe duck bespies du dynen got als du dynen broeder

msItem.title: Prayers on the sacrament
msItem.incipit: Here I.C. connick der engelen
O here I.C. connick der glorien
Gebenedit moetstu wesen suete here I.C. levendige broet
O here I.C. tys huden een dach
O heilige broet, O levendige broet
Here ich biddy dattu my wilste geven
O myn Got enn myn here enn myn schepper
O mynlicke here I.C., O ewige woert
O alre mechtichste enn alre barmhertichste God
msItem.note: For other MSS. see Meertens op.cit. VI.14

msItem.incipit: O here I.C. ic gruet dy vleische geheiliget in der ewicheit
Alle creatueren helpet my dancken
Dank seg ich dy here I.C. dattu my armen onwerdigen sonder
msItem.note: see Meertens VI.94

msItem.incipit: Ich danck dy enn love dy werde suete hemelsche vader
O here I.C. ich segge dy overbloedigen danck
O ewige hemelsche vader ich bid dy doer dynen gemynden soen
O here I.C. ich arme sundige mensche bid dy
O och zaerte mynlike here I.C.
O hemelsche vader wie bin ich dat gy my innen eengeboeren soen gegeven hebt
O suete here I.C. want du my myt dynen heiligen licham
O here I.C. want ich dy
O mynlike here I.C. nu bid ich dy om die mynlike werdicheit
O alre suetste mynlichste I.C. ich noede u
O du edel gast mynre selen

msItem.title: Meditation on the sacrament
msItem.incipit: In tween manieren ontfangen wy onsen lieven heren

msItem.rubric: Van den heiligen sacrament
msItem.incipit: Eyn mensche die gerne toe ons heren licham geit

msItem.title: Exemplum
msItem.note: in which Christ appears to a good man in the form of a child, and promises him life everlasting
msItem.rubric: Eyn leringe
msItem.incipit: Eyn guet mensche die plach te eren

msItem.title: Prayer
msItem.incipit: O utfruchtende enn verschrecklick Got

msItem.title: Prayer for all souls
msItem.incipit: Weest gegruet alle gelouyge selen
msItem.note: The Latin is pr.Leroquis Livres d'heures II.341. For other MSS. of this version see Meertens VI.43

msItem.title: Litany of the dead
msItem.incipit: O here vader genadige Got wanttu eyn troester

msItem.title: Prayer to St. Anthony the abbot
msItem.incipit: O heilige vader sante Anthonyus du biste eyn marscalck des heiligen levens

msItem.rubric: Dijt sal eyn mensche sprecken of hoeren voer synen dode
msItem.incipit: O mijn Got enn o myn here vader alre barmherticheit

msItem.rubric: Dijt sint die eynde woert Enn daer nae spreck drij werf of duyt vermachs die eynde woert
msItem.incipit: Here gewaer vader in dyne hande beuele ich mynen geist

msItem.title: Prayer after communicating
msItem.rubric: Eyn guet gebet nae der ontfenckenys
O here hemelsche vader du heb ick ontfangen

msItem.title: Prayer after communicating
msItem.rubric: O here nu heb ick ontfangen dynen heiligen licham

supportDesc.support: paper coat of arms showing three fleur de lys (two varieties, the second on fol. 92 and 245), cf. Briquet 1813–6 letter J, not in Briquet letter P, cf. Briquet 8615 tower, cf. Briquet 15908–11
supportDesc.collation: I16+2 ? (uncertain; last two leaves inserted?) (fols. 1–18) | II-IV12 (fols. 19–54) | V-VI12 (fols. 55–78) | VII10 (fols. 79–88) | VIII10 (fols. 89–98) | IX-X10 (fols. 99–118) | XI-XII12 (fols. 119–142), XIII10 (fols. 143–152) | XIV-XV12 (fols. 153–176) | XVI-XVII12 (fols. 177–200) | XVIII12 (fols. 201–212) | XIX-XXII8 (fols. 213–244) | XXIII8 (fols. 245–252); quire I loose, detached at the foot. no catchwords or quire signatures visible. Traces of leaf signatures remain on fols. 1–8 (ai-aviii in black ink), fols. 153–158 (apparently a, ai-aiii, aiiii in red ink), fols. 165–170 (bi-biiiiii in red ink).

layoutDesc.layout: 18 – 20 long lines. Partly frame ruled in pale leadpoint, apparently with only the top and side lines ruled; ruling often invisible; the ruled space variable, but typically about 70 mm. wide.

handDesc.handNote: Written by several scribes in scripts of varying quality and size

decoDesc.decoNote:
Large red initials, some with green and violet (fol.1) penwork.
One 5-line initial in red, with reserved areas, with purple penwork (fol. 1r); similar 3-line (fol. 11v) and a 2-line (fol. 79r) initials.
One 5-line initial in red, with reserved patterns, with pale purple penwork, some interstices filled with green (fol. 89r); one similar 4-line initial (fols. 89v).
One 4-line initial in red, with purple penwork, some interstices filled in with green or yellow (fol. 99r); three similar 3-line initials (fols. 19r, 55r, 119r, ); and a similar 3-line initials without yellow (fol. 153r).
One 4-line initial in red, with reserved patterns, infilled with plain brown ink penwork (fol. 218r); and a similar 3-line initial (fols. 216r).
Occasional 2-line iniitals in blue, one infilled with red penwork, fols. 220v-233v.
1-, 2-, and 3-line initials in plain red, some with reserved areas/patterns (e.g. fol. 81r, 230r, 232v); one similar 5-line initial (fols. 245r).

binding.p: Sewn on four bands, with (modern?) endbands; bound in (original?) wood boards with chamfered edges, recovered in plain modern brown leather, the spine unlettered; pastedowns of original(?) paper.

recordHist.source: Typescript description by Bodleian library staff, partly revised from draft description by Peter Kidd, late 1990s

ref.title: Handschriftencensus: Eine Bestandsaufnahme der handschriftlichen Überlieferung deutschsprachiger Texte des Mittelalters

revisionDesc.change: James Cummings Up-converted the markup using https://github.com/jamescummings/Bodleian-msDesc-ODD/blob/master/convertTolkien2Bodley.xsl
